author: potuz
content: TBH is not clear to me what's the right path forward for trusted payments: the original design allowed for trusted payments just exactly as today. But Lido insisted in that it would be better for them to have payments via withdrawals than transfers on the CL side. Had I known that  anyway they wouldn't  use trustless payments no matter what, then it would have been much simpler to just keep the original design that has the exact same features for those that want to use trusted payments and doesn't need to share the pipeline with withdrawals that is already ugly enough. We would still have to churn transfers and keep essentially the same system as today so it's not considerably simpler, but I believe the churn for validator transfers can be made independent of the churn for validator withdrawals/exits/deposits as it should not affect the total active balance.

author: potuz
content: It is also less flexible than the withdrawal path since it allows the operator to receive in any address instead of only the withdrawal credentials address.
